column4: Standard menu, we weren't disappointed, service was very nice! The collection is marvellous, I spent some time apologising to various groups in order to look at the items at their tables...
Loved this place so much. The staff are super friendly and the food was amazing. Reasonably priced and perfectly located. Loved the souvenirs.

column3: Hard Rock Cafe of New York
column4: I highly recommend for steak and burgers enthusiasts. Solid cousin, maybe a little overpriced but still good food. Big dishes tasty. Nothing to complain.
Chain with same menu, but good. Shopping also same as usual. Staff not helpful at all with same cramped store
Always visit a Hard Rock where possible and this Hard Rock didn't disappoint. Great restaurant, food and service. Definitely worth a visit if in New York.

While visiting New York, I always get a souvenir from Hard Rock establishments and decided to have lunch and ate some amazing food!!! Not being known for their food, I was totally surprised how fresh everything tasted!
Must visit when you are in time square,which is close place. Taste is not only the factor,but pleasing environment for dining. Like other places,this branch also established professional manner

First visit to any Hard Rock Cafe. They didn't disappoint, the service and food was excellent. We had cocktails too which were really good. To top it off we saw David Baddiel but my wife was too chicken to say hello.

A typical Hard Rock Cafe situated in the middle of Times Square. Both food and drink were reasonably priced and tasted good. There was a really nice atmosphere and if you want to watch sport there is a large screen.
Wonderful atmosphere in a classic hard rock venue. Great food and drink. Would go back again. Enjoy the alcohol free cocktails!

column3: They have the nicer staff in NYC
column4: I like music and I was happy to see all the collection guitars, shoes, dresses, etc belonging to "the very best" They had even the Abbey road real doors !! The food is very good, really tasty, and the staff was very very nice.
Been to several HRC and they never fail to satisfy. NYC Times Square Cafe is as good if not better than most. From the mayhem outside to a great atmosphere inside!
A little slow at the bar, but nice people doing a nice job! Centrally located in the heart of time square.

We were disappointed to find a queue at the Hard Rock Cafe and a half hour wait. We opted to take a seat at the bar and were able to eat there instead of waiting. Really great atmosphere and burger, very American!

column3: Great atmosphere, food and gift shop!
column4: Very impressed with this store, they have everything you'd expect from a Hard Rock franchise, however is the people that works there that make it special, not over the top, just right. I had a great lunch there too.

column3: Good food but freezing cold inside
column4: There is a lot of music memorabilia to look at. The food is good. However it is very cold inside and for us the music was far too loud.
a MUST in new york! it's a nice place, a spectacular wall with only guitars. the food is the same as allover. so we entered only to the shop to buy some stuff.

There was nothing special about this HRC. Decent food and rock and roll atmosphere with lots of memorabilia. If you have never been to one then it is interesting but if you have been to any other one, nothing new here to see.
Food is OK, but price, drinks are good but pricey. This is a Gard Rock Cafe, not too different tan others, pretty much exclusively for tourists or people that have not yer visited a Gard Rock Cagfe.

Wow..just wow.. I went to 3 different hard rock cafe on my last trip.. and this HRC is the best. from the rock shop's collection, the atmospher, the location, the crwods, everything... The staffs also very helpful.
Checked out the memorabilia , Beatles outfits from Ed Sullivan Show , Lady Gaga from Madame Treaseau's , Guitar wall!!! ... fun stuff... great bathrooms...

The hard rock is overrated, I've been to a few and this wasn't anything spectacular. Crazy busy in this place, waited for 45 minutes for a table for two. Our server was great though as were most of the other waiters.

Situated in bustling Times Square this is a very busy restaurant with pleasant and efficient staff, the food is good and the decor is brilliant. You could spend half an hour looking at the wall displays of music memorabilia. Well worth a visit.
The food was ok. I ordered a hamburger well done and it was almost well done. The decor is nice. Staff was very professional and friendly.
I love the laid back atmosphere, with the rock and top 20's music blaring. The food is great and in a centralized location in Times Square.

Good dining experience. Bit pricey but you expect that for- 1) the chain & 20) Its location. Good service, a little noisy but great for music memorabilia lovers. I myself spent little time at the table, preferring to look around

column3: "Great Visit to check out all the Musician's History of our Time & More"
column4: We throughly enjoyed all the history of the Musician's of their time and to see all of the musical instruments right down to Billy Joel's motor bike. Friendly staff and well worth the visit if you are musically inclined.
I love atmosphere and environment of this franchise. One of the best choises in NYC. Try their coctails.
Had a pre paid vochure which often creates a pronlem but not here! Fan time had b y us all! Well done!

Food good and plenty ,loved the burgers, staff cool and very busy ,but to me (only my opition)I found it a young persons place,very loud music, I should have expected this,showing my age,but go for it if you are young at heart and enjoy
Whether you are alone, traveling as a couple or with friends you have to stop by this place as it is not only historical in nature but has fantastic service and huge menu that should satisfy anyone.
Typical Hard Rock fare, we love their burgers!, Also dessert is always a favorite. Chocolate Cake YUM!

This is one of my two favorite Hard Rock cafes in the whole world. It is located at Times square, where its been for 10 years. This restaurant and its merchandise shop are always busy. Good vibes, good food, good service!

Strange as it may seem this was my first visit to this chain it will not be my last. I'm not usually a fan of burgers but the ones here could certainly convert me. It was delicious! Look forward to my next visit
Great place for food, atmosphere and the service is fast. The price is a bit expensive but everything else is worth the detour

We had lunch here during our recent family trip to NYC. Kids and adults enjoyed the atmosphere a lot. Nice opportunity to get picture taken with kids holding guitars against "guitar wall". Food was good, but not great. Overall an enjoyable experience.

It is similar to other franchise store all over the world except the abundance of security personnel everywhere. The bar was good and bar tenders are professional but not compare to other cool places all over NYC.
Went for breakfast and it was not good. Both the food and service were not good at all unfortunately. There are many other far better places in the area to go to
Good food, good atmosphere, great dining experience. Very large dining area, but advise to go earlyish as a queue was already forming at 18:00..
This restaurant was very costly for very average food and drinks. We couldn't finish our food as it was tasteless, I had the macaroni which was quite sickly.
Average food although Service was good. Had to wait for 30 minutes for a table but could have a drink at the bar. Drinks and food a little overpriced for what it is.

The food here is average at best, on par with any chain restaurant the draw is the rock memorabilia. Very cool memorabilia on display, does not make up for over priced average food items. Kids menu provides nice coloring book/souvenir

column3: A must try - original burger is outstanding
column4: Walking the area of Times Square renders hundreds of restaurants, but Hard Rock is a must try. Museum and surroundings gives you a great setting, food is good quality and prices are, considering the neighbour hood, reasonable. In addition good cocktails and nice desserts.
Loved this place, from the memorabilia, to the staff and the food!! Bought quite a lot of stuff from the shop too as my kids collect their T Shirts from wherever they go.
Usual Hard Rock set up with brilliant surroundings and great atmosphere. Went twice, once just for beers and enjoyed. Returned night after for food and was not disappointed.
The restaurant had tons of memorabilia. We enjoyed our meal, however seating was a little congested.
I've been to Hong Kong, Barcelona, Mumbai, Paris, London,Edinburgh and Glasgow but this is the best so far for memorabilia and atmosphere.
Obvious ambiance. Great server and friendly staff. Barbecue ribs were somewhat tasteless and not very meaty. Onion rings were a bit soggy.

column3: Always wanted to visit here...glad I did
column4: Great vibe love the theatre style of this place and music theme, bar staff a little officious asking for ID I wasn't flattered I found it annoying, I'm 50 for crying out loud Bit expensive for basically burger and chips

column3: Fun place. Alot to see and great casual food.
column4: Nice staff, great food and a lot of fun. If you are looking for a casual place to dine, this would be the place.
Had a great Piggy Sandwich here on my birthday and got a free hot fudge sundae. Server was fun and friendly and efficient. Food was delicious and I didn't have to wait long for it.Super atmosphere.
We waited a long time for dinner but it was totally worth it. The food was very good and we enjoyed our meal.
Good choice if you are in Times Square area. Food was great and so was the service. Enjoyed everything about the restaurant.
Great fun and music. Expensive but entertaining. Happened to be there on my birthday and they sang happy birthday and gave me my choice of dessert. Fun!,,,,,

column3: Amazing as always at hard rock cafe's!
column4: Visited twice on our recent NY trip. As always our experience at hard rock the service was great - very attentive and friendly and fantastic food wth huge portions. Loved it!
i stopped by after i had dinner in bubba gump restaurant. i bought t shirt and other souvenir. It is located in a very strategic location in Broadway
Food was above average in quality....quantity was large....price was high....but you are in Times Square!!! Go for it as a one time experience. Really noisy.
Your typical Hard Rock. Overpriced drinks, loud music, and a crowd. It is generally what you would expect it to be.
The food was excellent and the service great. Not to much noise and not to crowded. Will definitely go there again.
This is a high energy and large HRC. No wait when we were there (lucky on that front). It's big and busy inside - fun - kids loved it. Food and service were both very good. Great experience.
$17 per person for all you can eat buffet, food was ok, but not great. Service a bit slow but friendly. Central location by Time Square

Like most Hard Rocks around the world, this is the same. You know what to expect! The burgers are good, the children looked after and the music loud. A great location in Time Square if you're willing to wait a little. The line moves quick.

column3: Cool store, meal not worth the wait
column4: We go to every Hard Rock when we travel. I'd go here if you collect trinkets, but elsewhere for a meal, especially in NYC
Good restaurant in good place near Times Square . Three are a lot of amazing things. Staff was OK too.
Wanted a quick burger meal on way to a Broadway play down the street. Hard Rock Cafe was on the way so we went in. Got that burger in the bar area. Quicker service than the dining area.

column3: Not a Better View of Times Square
column4: Lunch at the Hard Rock Café on Times Square may not be unique and exciting, but it has predictably good food and the best seat in the house for Times Square.

column3: The Hard Rock is Not What it Used to Be.
column4: A once reliable place to go for a decent meal at an okay price. This Times Square location has been a nightmare since it opened. How things have changed since the Hard Rock's 57th Street days and not for the better I'm sorry to say.
Another great Hard Rock Cafe'!!! This is a " must stop" when in NYC!!!! Great Time! The Ribs are to die for. The décor here is fabulous and the service is outstanding!!!
Mediocre meal and service just something that you gotta do if you come to new york wouldn't go again had better burgers and ribs in hells kitchen
We had a great meal here, service was excellent and the fiid was plentiful and tasty. Great location too.
A short wait of 10 mins, our waitress was lovely and engaging. Our food arrived quickly, hot and massive! The food was so good.... Would recommend this place only negative is it really is quite loud!
In NYC, I love Hardrock, why not. Location: Can't miss it Price: to expensive Food: greasy and pub food... Service: great Looking for an experience..go for it! G
good food here you get plenty it seemed to be extra loud with the music could hardly hear yourself speak but enjoyed it anyway service very good and quick
Nice place amazing atmosphere, excellent atmosphere with great service and good food. take a place at the bar and enjoy!!

column3: One of the best Hard Rocks
column4: The food in Hard Rock is mainly the same but the atmosphere and exhibits here make this one of the betterHard Rocks, nice at,ops here in side and didn't have to wait to long despite it being busy. Large shop as well
Was not as good as I remembered the last time I was there. Didn't feel satisfied when we left. However the guitar pictures were cute and fun. And there was no wait for a table!

column3: Just typical Hard Rock really, you could have been anywhere in the world in an HR Cafe
column4: As with every Hard Rock Café I have ever been in, the menu was just as you would expect, service was good, food nice etc. He arrived about 9.30pm and waited around 10 mins for a table so no issues.

Great space in the madness of Times Square. Great to get away from the hustle outside and escape into a world of rock memorabilia. We went at 5pm and were seated immediately. Food was quick and tasty with large portions and the service was great.
Right in the center of Times Square! A great place to grab a beverage and a bite to eat while touring the city.
By far the best steak I had in NY, it was cooked perfectly, the mash potato was great as well and the green beans were cooked to perfection, I know where I'm going next time,
This Hard Rock Cafe is good..The food here is very good.The prices similar to other restaurants around here. The set is slow because it's always very crowed.
Typical restaurant but the chain is still one of my favorites. Loved the margarita flight sampler that comes with chips. Got seated quickly and server was nice.

We went to see Darlene Love she was having a rehearsal there and her performance was great! The food was just average burgers, salads, sandwiches etc..I would'nt waste my time going there just for dinner only.
Had to wait 40 minutes to get a table. Crowded as it was, it took a while to get our order. When it finally arrived, it wasn't correct. Great hot fudge brownie, though. They got that right, at least.
busy, rather dirty and dull. we ended up sitting in the old dance floor - food was average and the beer like drinking soap. tables sticky .... very disappointed can't say I'd go back
Great atmosphere and surroundings. The staff are very friendly. Food and drink menu's great. Would definately go back.
Stumbled there after watching evening show on Broadway. The place is fun, the food is good. It was a perfect end to a wonderful evening in Manhattan.
After many years (a decade) this place still rocks. Good feeling, fast and clean service. Cold beer, BIG cocktails and basic, but tasty food. What else do you need ?
Service slow, beer flat, burger tasteless, price high, location great, seating comfortable, decoration good

We have been to a few hard rock cafes and this one didn't disappoint one bit, great service as always, food fantastic and very filling, atmosphere excellent good beer. Make sure you pre book or be prepared to wait for an hr or more. 10/10

column3: Fantastic experience, as I've come to expect from Hard Rock!
column4: As always, had a great meal from Hard Rock! Awesome atmosphere, one of the best I've been to. Will definitely be back!

column3: Great Hard Rock experience as expected.
column4: Stopped in here for a late lunch whilst visiting Times Square. Drinks were made quickly and refreshingly cold. Food could have been better but was edible and satisfying nonetheless. Server was very attentive and welcoming, great musical artefacts and items on show too.
$17 for all you can eat breakfast .toast bacon saus egg fruit cereal tea coffee pastries .so go enjoy

Always love the Hard Rock Cafe brand, NYC is one of my favourite restaurants that I have visited, customer service is always top notch, food always delicious, always reasonably priced, can't wait to go back :)
Greates Place to have burgers. These werde just delicous, yummy and a big dish. Friendly and outgoing waiter, and Music playing all Night Long. All in all a fun Dinner.

column3: Despite its location and number of customers, very good
column4: Its so busy here, but the good and service was surprisingly good. Food delivered very quickly, staff were attentive, all good.
Visited Hard rock cafe when we were in NYC last autumn - really good food and very friendly and quick service. Very easy location and handy for when you want to stop for a quick dinner!
You know what you are going to get from a HRC and this one was no different. Nice service, ok food but nothing special. Ok if you want a quick bite to eat.
Just in the middle of the square, where all the buzz is. You have to come and drink a hot chocklate when its cold out side. I loved the people there and the music as well.

column3: Lovely food, but the air conditioning meant we felt it too cold to stay long
column4: Another good restaurant to visit serving lovely food but this year we found it was very cold in the restaurant due to the air conditioning, which meant our food went cold very quickly.
It was nice to have a restaurant nearby where they serve you. I like that they take a picture of you when you enter. The place is huge. The atmosphere and food was good.
This particular Hard Rock is conveniently located in Times Square. We stopped in for lunch and received top-notch service. The food was cooked as requested.

column3: better for a family meal I think
column4: Some of the drinks don't have prices on them and we found out why when we got the bill, $17 for 1 average cocktail. We waited a long time for those drinks as well. Tasting platter was ok.
nice option to have dinner and enjoy good music and food Pros Memorabilia Music enviroment Cons well it is not a con, but once you heva tried a Hard rock the food is the same every otherone

Good food at a reasonable price for a chain restaurant. Gluten free options available, they have GF burger buns....so you can have virtually any burger....fries are safe also. Helpful staff and reasonably short wait times.
This place is HUGE! It's right in the heart of Times Square. Excellent food, our waitress was on the ball and the prices were similar to other HRC's.
It was a fabulous time. The food was great and what was good is that you could see all the memorabilia around and that was fantastic
A local rock really, friendly Staff. Good music for an evening trasgressive. Please return to Hard Rock New York :-)
My husband and I found it open on a weekday night when everything around was already closed...we shared a sandwich with a couple of drinks and a milkshake at the bar.
Great atmosphere , location is good, food was nice and hot. Just how you'd expect a hard rock to be .

column3: An experience out of the movies
column4: To get away from busy Times Square enter into planet Hollywood on the upper levels, great burgers but watch out for the overloud music A great place to see exhibits from movies and future movies to see
We had a wonderful waitress and the staff couldn't have been more accomodating! Nachos were wonderful and could easily be split between two people. Will definitely be back on a return trip to NYC.
we went there for dinner, was very nice, we had to wait a bit but nothing terrible. The food quality was quite good and the service fast and friendly.
We were slightly worried after reading previous reviews on this restaurant. However, our waitress was very friendly, our food arrived promptly and it was very good. We would definitely visit again.
Excellent service! Awesome food - typical American, and not only! Great attraction! You can buy souvenirs there too.

Location is excellent , the business is excellent , service is ok , but the design Ian's atmosphere is not as good as others I have been to in the same chain . Box like and not enough screens and music volume too low .
The food and service were amazing and the atmosphere was cool and inviting. The kitchen sent the food out quickly, with a great presentation and it was all amazing

column3: Like all the other hard rocks
column4: It is exactly what you expect it to be, just like every other Hard Rock Cafe. The vibe is ok. The wait staff was fine. The food was average a bit over priced for a upscale burger joint

I have visited many Hard Rock restaurants before and I am not a big fan but this one top as one of the worst ones. The food and service were terrible. The cheeseburger is their "main dish" and it was edible. Not worth the visit.

I am a seasoned HRC eater but not been for a few years. They knew their food, knew what was gluten free and it was all delicious. 8yr old loved it. Had to wait about 20 mins for a table but that was fine.
Service is perfect. Meali ara delicious. Meal portions are bigger than we used to eat. A funny and quality restaurant.
For a chain restaurant close to a huge tourist area, this was a great meal. Great service and good food in a fun atmosphere - just what we were looking for.
Good variety on menu. I tried the Princess Diaries fruit smoothie. Very good! Great location in Times Square too.
Very average food, ok'ish setting. Our waitress was rude when we indicated that our drink was not as ordered. Would not rush to go back...
Tasty meal while visiting Time Square.. Didn´t wait long for a table. Its your basic american restaurant.
I visited this establishment with my family. The wait was a bit long but once we were seated the service was amazing. I assume it's a tourist attraction so waiting comes with that.

column3: Great atmosphere NO PRICES DISPLAYED ON MENU
column4: Always busy great place to soak up atmnosphere and good food but VERY DEAR . I have been a few times and loved it .
Freezing cold in the room, waiting quite a long time for our burgers which were not so nice in the end. Cocktails were more icy than anything else expected... Food was not bad but not exciting!

column3: New York - Hard Rock - same feeling - Awesome
column4: Cannot go wrong with the Burgers out here, a must for every one who Visits New York, Friendly Staff and service as impeccable as always...keep Rockin

column3: You are not allowed to get a drink!!!
column4: We came into this "bar" around 11pm when we found all the bar stools taken. We took other chairs at a table but we were denied these places. So we stood at the bar area but were not allowed to!! Who runs this fake place?

column3: Hard Rock Rocks in all countrys!
column4: I visited this place with a friend and we have the most fun time, you can take pictures with famous guitars, the decoration is very avant-garde. Excellent food and great atmosphere for a drink and relax. I loved it!

column3: Hard Rock rocks like rock song
column4: Typical Hard Rock Cafe Experience! Daughter LOVED the lemonade. Everything else was, well, Hard Rock Cafe. The place is huge and I can imagine a long line on busy days. However, we went on a slow day and everything went smoothly.
Loved it. Great atmosphere. And a Michael Jackson impersonator came out and entertained the crowd while we ate dinner. We like to hit the Hard Rock in every city we visit.

A lively buzz began with our server and continued throughout the meal, a great location, noise, atmosphere and we were served efficiently and with charm. Photo opportunities abound and there is plenty on the menu to engage diners. This deserves return visits.

Though this is generally a tourist spot in any city, this store was enjoyable in its own right. Extremely busy, but you are able to sit at the bar and order off the full menu. I was in and out in about 30 minutes.
Good place for lunch. Tasty sandwiches and good service. Lots of memorabilia to look at while you wait. We didn't have to wait for a table, but there was a long line when we left.
We had walked an awful lot and the Hard Rock Café had no wait, had wonderful service and the food was delicious! You don't want to miss it!
Food was fantastic, staff were quirky and very friendly. Decorations very interesting. Would recommend booking in advance to avoid waiting!

column3: fun place to eat and shop!
column4: I love Hard Rocks everywhere....I ate nachos this time but they have the best burgers!! Our service was good and I love the fun upbeat music and entertainment. I have to shop and look at memorabilia too....
The service was good and all the burgers come with french fries and sauce and they are very big. It's perfect for a little break for lunch and to spend some time with the family.

column3: Great food and fun for families
column4: Took our teenage grandson to celebrate as part of his graduation trip to NYC. Great place to eat and interesting decor. Would definitely go here again
We had a great dinner at the hard Rock and the lip sync by one of the waiters to lady Gaga was an added bonus! Our waitress was very attentive. My son loved his burger & the nachos were yummy too!
Over priced service is terrible. Breakfast was a shambles would rather of given my money to the tramps outside than to this awful rip off restaurant.
very busy place with interesting rock decorations, we needed to que and wait for 15 min. the service was very basic, the food was overpriced..
Why do so many tourists flock to this chain restaurant? With so many other places to visit in NY and better food to eat, why go here?
Made to feel very welcome, Bar man was really helpful and professional. Food was excellent. Would return if in New York again.
I like this brand and it is always on a high level. Good interior,good food but prices are not cheap. Good american place
The food is okay but the atmosphere is good. Nice photo opportunity area where you can take your own photo in front of Hard Rock background. The large guitar hanging over the stairway is neat.

Right near center of Times Square, was told 25 min wait on a Sat afternoon, buzzer given and waiting area is big, buzzed in only 10 min. Air conditioning felt great on July day. Server very friendly, all our lunches were very good

Went here for breakfast. Not much to say other than poor choice and quality of food (served in a buffet style) with an expensive price tag. The redeeming feature would be the building itself which was interesting to take a look around.
We were able find a seat at the bar right away. Bar tender was great. Food was cooked to order and the service was awesome.
The Hard Rock Cafe was a truly fabulous experience. The atmosphere was fun and the food was excellent. The wait staff were very friendly and attentive. I would highly recommend this venue.

Just like any other Hard Rock Cafe around the world, you should firstly visit to see the memorabilia as there is always something that you will have never seen before. As for the food, I ordered the Legendary Bacon Cheeseburger and was disappointed.

column3: good food as usual - very poor service
column4: the place is as good as usual, the food is so good as usual, but what a deception about staff attitude, poor service, long service, so unusual over there. not good at all

This is a good place to stop in and have a drink to see all the music memorabilia etc. There is much better food throughout the City however the location in Time Square is easy to find and get to walking.
Good food, good service, lot's of interesting memorabilia to look at while you wait for a table. Been twice, would go again.

column3: Nice food , great memorabilia, good experience
column4: We visited the shop and since there were tables available we also have visited the restaurant. The food was great, the memorabilias were perfect and the staff very friendly. We loved it.

I was excited to visit Hard Rock in NY. The wait was not as long as I thought it would be. We were seated and the waiter came over fairly quickly, Food was delicious, friendly wait staff. Would go again.
See the memorabilia, take a lot of pics, food is American what else cocktails great people all over world
Very Busy of course, service sucked but overall it was your normal experience for Hard Rock. Over priced, busy, poor service but atmosphere is always fun and entertaining!
One of the best places to hangout in Time Square. Just order anything from the menu, it will be great. Do try nachos and Long island iced tea.

Ambience of this place rocks. Wide variety of yummy cocktails. Just wish they had prices on the menu. Food ok. First place my hubby said of "before we leave NY, I'm definitely coming here for a second visit "
We were not very hungry so ordered just appetizers. Great service . Always tory to eat at a Hard Rock Café to see the décor.
We visited with a group and a pre-selected menu. 72 of us served very quickly and the food was good.
Great place for lunch. Hamburgers and salads delicious. Memorabilia is really interesting. Staff very efficient.

column3: Standard experience, but no prices on the wine list
column4: The food, service and ambience was the same as always. Good experience, exactly what we expected. However, the wine list had no prices. How can I decide what to order if I don't know what it is going to cost?

column3: Good service and friendly staff in a great location
column4: Great location, staff in the restaurant where very friendly and polite, food was good. Food and drinks served promptly. Also very good atmosphere in the restaurant with lots of memorabilia on the walls. Highly recommended.

For Hard Rock Cafe the bar is really ok but with the burger we have been little disappointed especially as you know you pay more as its a Hard Rock Cafe. So go there if you like the atmosphere but not because of food.
This place has nothing on the Orlando one. The low rating is justified. Food was average. Service was slow. Not her fault, she no doubt had heaps of tables to attend to.
Had burgers from a speciality menu. They were of good quality, but dull. Have visited HRC in many countries and this place was below average.
good burgers good location . lots of rock and music items. excellent service set in an old theatre gets very busy.
Always a great place to visit. Dinner, snacks, cocktails, atmosphere always hard to beat. And of course you have to pick up a pin or a t-shirt

column3: Food as expected, waiter in a bad mood
column4: HRC NYC is large. Not crowded when we visited the place. Food was classic HRC as expected. Service was not. Our waiter had something to learn about being polite. There are better places to eat in NYC.
Cocktails really good each night we would finish off our day in Hard Rock Cafe, staff great and they make great cocktails .
Very disappointed with this restaurant. Service was slow food very disappointing. Music far too loud. Fancy stuff around the walls but that's it. Avoid
Every time I've been here it's always busy didn't have to wait too long at all thanks to the rain Great food great staff and visited gift shop too Would come back again
We thought we'd have a good, hearty breakfast here, but it was just like any other bad motel buffet table. Price wasn't too bad $17, but it wasn't worth it.
the concept is probably known to everyone, the food is excellent and the service friendly and proffesional, and you can see some ''relics'' from stars, it isnt the cheapest but for once it cant hurt
Great place, lovely staff. Food was great. Had photo taken but was not asked to purchase it. Also visited for cocktails which are very impressive.
We felt like at home. The service was great all the time and I would like to make an special mention to Garfield, a good man with a fantastic sense of humor. Thanks Garfield!!
great food great place and great staff went inside to chill before a flight and the staff could not have been nicer

Went to a wedding do there had burgers and a dreadful cheesecake there,poor service,was not busy,plastic covers,a half cooked burger with bacon and cheese ,not good,worst cheesecake ever,no cream or anything with a plain new york cheesecake.
Came in for lunch, it was busy but we were well taken care of and the food came quickly. Everything was great... It's a HRC and it does exactly what you expect from one.

Large and interesting space, burgers were good, pleasant enough place to have a couple of beers. It felt like the chain it has become, reliable.... yes, but not quite as unique as it used to be. Would return though.
We stopped here for a quick meal before a show. Nice food but nothing special. Great location for a pre Broadway bite to eat.
a really nice way to close my first day @ ny really good food. really good staff. I had a very good time there..
No matter how crowded the place is, you will get top quality food, and outstanding service. Fantastic location, right in the heart of Times Square.

Long wait, I like Hard Rocks but went because my daughter wanted too. With so many restaurants to choose from in NYC I would not choose again. Drinks and food were fine. You of course went through gift shop to get in .
I love it and I would definitely go there more than once. Good music, much space, not smoky, nice bathrooms. Prices fine and staff cool!

Food was very average. Poor beer selection. The atmosphere pails in comparison to other hard rock cafes around the world. And the service? Absolutely shocking!!!!! 30 mins to place an order - 30 mins to get the first round of drinks. Shocking.

column3: Best layout of a Hard Rock ever!
column4: I sat here for 3 hours waiting on a friend to travel from Philadelphia, and it flew by. The staff were friendly, the bar is massive and the cocktails are perfect. I used the wifi and talked to fellow customers at the bar. Then we...More

column3: Deceitful selling, noisy but good food
column4: Good food but otherwise I would avoid it.  The music in the restaurant (as in all the other HRCs I've visited) is way too loud. It is impossible to have a conversation and it is very uncomfortable to have a dinner there.  We were "forced" to buy two glasses. The waiter said that we can pick two glasses from the souvenir shop as we leave. The waiter made us believe the glasses were included but they were not, in the receipt there was a price for them. We were not asked if we wanted to buy the glasses, they were automatically added to the price! This we noticed after we had paid. And as we were not interested in the glasses in the first place, we actually forgot to take them from the souvenir shop.  The waiter also told to tick which tip we wanted to leave as if we wouldn't know how the tipping works (the options were 18% or 20%), i.e. they steer the customer to leave a specific amount of tip, even if the service is not worth it.
No matter how crowded the place is, you will get top quality food, and outstanding service. Fantastic location, right in the heart of Times Square.

Long wait, I like Hard Rocks but went because my daughter wanted too. With so many restaurants to choose from in NYC I would not choose again. Drinks and food were fine. You of course went through gift shop to get in .

column3: Very loud - hard to carry on conversation
column4: We were here about 6pm. We did not have any trouble being seated as there was no line. I ordered the Salmon (22.95) and it was ok. My husband ordered the NY strip steak (29.95) and it was just average. Our server (Oscar) was good. The problem we had with this establishment was the noise. The music was too loud. It was very hard to carry on a conversation without yelling. This will not be on our return visit list.
I love it and I would definitely go there more than once. Good music, much space, not smoky, nice bathrooms. Prices fine and staff cool!

column3: Good quality but you can enjoy the museum more
column4: You 1st go and put your name on the waiting list (it is in time square so i guess it will be crowded all day), then you can go around checking the museum and take some nice photos. as for the restaurant staff are friendly food is good but too much calories :) we had the sampler appetizer and it has like 2000+ calories so we had to cancel our main courses ( we were 2 ). prices are fair compared to the location

Food was very average. Poor beer selection. The atmosphere pails in comparison to other hard rock cafes around the world. And the service? Absolutely shocking!!!!! 30 mins to place an order - 30 mins to get the first round of drinks. Shocking.

column3: Good burgers shame about the service
column4: We have been to hard rock in every city we have visited and find that the food is always good, the burgers are my personal favourite, chicken or beef they are all excellent, my only issue here at Times Square is the service, hostesses are friendly, but bar service is shocking, waiting 20minutes for the miserable server to get to you, ordering food and not being asked for any sauces ect? Then having to shout one of the 4 bar tenders over who are busy having a chat for another drink, it's such a shame as the food and drink are actually really good once you get them.... We will be back to give it another go hopefully it will be better next time

column3: Delicious food, served in a fun and friendly setting
column4: First, I want to state that this is a repeat review. I was at the Hard Rock Cafe in New York City and it never disappoints me. Jeremy (or Jerome? My memory fails me sometimes) at the bar recognized me and took my order and served me a beverage quickly. For someone dining alone (or as a couple), the bar is a pleasant place to enjoy yourself. I can talk Hard Rock pins or food or New York events and be as comfortable as in my living room. I talked with several other people, each visiting from outside New York. One was from Kansas for company business in "the City," and the other person was visiting from upstate a little bit; her journey, likely by train concluded with appetizers and a drink. I'm sorry I forgot your name exactly, but I've got to remember to say "Happy Birthday" and being recognized by another bartender and someone in the Rock Shop was great. Jose, it was interesting talking with you. I hope to connect with you again and continue the conversation.
We had to wait half an hour, but the food was very good. Price is ok 😉 I was surprised about the really delicious and spicy spareribs

Nice atmosphere. Great menu copious amount of food! Reasonably priced. Plenty room. Tried to eat there a second time during our trip, however left it too late to get a table. Would definately recommend
I love the hard rock cafe. The food is amazing and the staff are extremely friendly. Myself and my husband ate here 4 times during our stay in new York. I strongly recommend.
A Big well rounded menu. Great drink selection in the Bar. Friendly staff and plenty of seating available.

Stopped here after a long day of sightseeing in NYC. Busy and great atmosphere. Bar staff were all very friendly. Plenty of choice on the cocktail menu. We had 2 each and they all tasted beautiful would defiantly visit again
Incredibly, in all my visits to NY I had not come to the HRC. Sat by the bar and had a decent meal and a good time listening to new and old tunes!
Love this place, tasty food, wondeful things inside, the wall with guitars, the Beatles at the entrance. The location just in front of times square. I wish to have the chance to come more often.

I have dietary restrictions which required a special order that was handled with no problem at all. Thank you to Kelly who was a wonderful waitress. I recommend to anyone who is in New York to stop in.

column3: A load of fuss about nothing special
column4: Had to try it while in Manhattan. Nothing special, except the service, Danny was a real credit to a very average dining experience. Food was ok but there is so. Much better around,and not at sch a cost.

Hard Rock Cafe is always a favorite, because it's a great value and good food. They are very good at dealing with crowds, and move people in and out efficiently.We enjoy looking around at the unique music collectors items at each restaurant.
the staff are friendly the food was excellent and a great meal after a long flight. Burgers to die for!!!!!!!!!
Good food! Cool place!! With lots of famous artistes memorabilia. Our waiter was really fun and helpful! We had a very good non-alcohol drink with mango,
we regulary visit this chain everywhere we go, apart from the place needing a good clean, the food was medioca and the shop was very small and boring
Been there alone I think but this place gather really cool people who likes music and quality service.
The food was great and the atmosphere was really nice too. This was by far the best place we ate while in NYC.
They are all the same so when you have been to one you have been to them all. good service, good food, good value nothing great but nothing bad.

column3: The original Hard Rock Cafe really delivers
column4: The original Hard Rock Cafe really delivers their specialties and we were very impressed with the food even the children had nice ones.

Love the restaurant food was good and the restaurant had a lot of attractions from movies. all of us had so much fun a alot of different kinds of food to order and drinks and enjoyed everything love everything about it.
The atmosphere has a rocky relaxed theme which is perfect for after a day of shopping or sight seeing. There was a variety of food and there were music channels playing so we had a little singalong.
only had to wait 30 minutes which was enough time to see around all the memrorabilia and gift shop. food was tasty with huge portions service was quick considering how busy the place was.

Went for food and the queue was 1.5hrs, however if you go to the bar for a drink while you wait you can eat there and you are effectively skipping the queue, which was excellent for us. Try the New York strip, was very nice.

column3: Been here a few times when we visit, this was by far the most disappointing.
column4: Had dinner here in December with my friend & our four teenagers. Our server was nice, but our orders were incorrect, items were omitted. Food was not as good as it had been in the past. Very disappointing especially for the price you pay.
we waited in the queue for 20 mins to be seated. the music was great, however the food was not worth the wait or the $$ our waiter was very friendly !
Fantastic food, fantastic staff and fantastic memorabilia. We plan to visit as many Hard Rocks around the world as we can.
Like every hard rock in the world 👍👍👍 cool !!! Good music, confortable waiters and also some of them sing, that is great. A good place to visit.
The last time I went to NY, the team's Hard Rock was not as cut as usual. I had problems with the collection of the account on travel card, but that was resolved days later by the manager.

Visited during our stay in NYC and it didn't disappoint. We love a good meal in a great atmosphere and we got it all. Had the legendary burger and it was delicious! Would most certainly go to this one again.
huge place,.... nice guitar wall,....!!! Went in for a couple of beers,...nice choice, good music too, trip back down memory lane, 80's style. Friendly staff.
very good food. very good beer and very friendly staff. the man serving us was very kind and helpful in helping us find our way to our next destination. their mac and cheese is yum
Quick service once your seated, good choice of food! Food was good nothing special but the atmosphere is great! The shop is good too.

column3: It's decent but nothing massively special
column4: Worth going because the burgers are delicious. Prices aren't the best but worth going whilst in nyc I suppose. Burgers are good
we only went in to the shop and ended up going for cocktails - they were yummy and not too expensive! the service was great and we would've gone back in to eat if we hadn't run out of time!!

This was a must see. Inside was huge, lots of rock memorabilia, almost felt like a museum. Food was lovely and well cooked and reasonably priced. Served by a lovely gentleman called Chad who made our day!
We only had drinks in fairness, however, the drinks were really good and we had good service with it. Worth a visit for a drink.
So disappointing!!!!! Staff unfriendly, Food crap and bathrooms ABSOLUTLEY filthy dirty!!!!!! Don't waste your time or money!!!!!
We have eaten her quite a few times and have never been disappointed. Burgers are a must! The staff are always polite and helpful. The restaurant always has a great atmosphere! Love it!

If you have been to one Hard Rock, you pretty much have been to them all. I enjoy the Rock Memorabilia at each location that is different so I always stop in when traveling. Also their vegetarian burger is great!

column3: All Rock enthusiast must stop were legends were!
column4: Its nice to stop in this place, the place where showman performed! You can go through the legends exhibits. You can take photos of these icons!

Been to others and this is hands down the best. Food was delicious and the bacon topped hard shake is a taste sensation. It's not cheap for dinner but it's worth it for the wings. And the pulled pork. And the skins too :)
we had great drinks and food, atmosphere was very welcoming and the waiter was very helpful. When we go back to NYC we will def go back again.

Although this must be one of the world's best locations among Hard Rock Cafes, the food, service and atmosphere never seem to change. Great place to sit back and simultaneously process your food and experiences.
The best location for a big and jucy burger, simply hard Roch culture. Must visit if in town. Careful with desert :)
Eating there is not a big deal. You won't love or hate it. It's great for shopping their souvenirs. Their T-shirts are stylish..
Went for the Breakfast buffet, poor service, terrible food. With so many good little cafés don't waste your money on this place for breakfast. Enough said really,
Great food & great atmosphere to be enjoyed! loved our time here and will defiantly be returning. good work

Super cool Hard Rock Café! We waited around 45 minutes to dine for dinner. As your waiting you can walk around browse the café and store. This is by far one of my favorite Hard Rock Cafe's I have visited. Super fun and lively atmosphere.
Bar staff helped get us seated with a minor. Even asked a customer to move over for us! Everything after that was slow. Food was good as per the standard. Enjoy

We spent the christmas eve dinner and christmas day dinner too. The staff is super nice. The portions are very generous, do not underestimate it. Also the drinks, the fruitpalooza was one of the most delicious drinks i have ever drunk.

column3: Great food, Cold Drinks, Great atmosphere (just like always)!!
column4: The price of food and drinks at Hard Rock is very reasonable especially for NYC. The bartender (during the day on Sat.) wasn't the friendliest I've had at Hard Rocks. The waiter (Rocko) at our lunch table was awesome, very accommodating and informative.

Ate lunch with my family before Pinstripe Bowl game, 12/2014. Great atmosphere, food was good, wait time was set at 45 minutes, but seated after about only 25. Service was good. Great selection for kids.
Nothing like a visit to a Hard Rock cafe and where better Times Square. Great fun, attentive staff. Fab food. All the stars things everywhere to be looked at, great atmosphere.
It was a great experience and food was pretty good. It was a little pricy for what you get but welcome to new york.
The staff are really friendly, the food is good (no more than expected) and the pricing is standard. Great atmosphere but all in all no more than expected of a hard rock.
I had a couple of beers at the bar with a lil burger (1200kcal) nice music and friendly staff. Nice hard rock
Didn't notice anything special, crazy overpriced. If you're not looking for anything history special place, check out other places with better service and food.

A busy day for the cafe, too many private parties. Main dining area was slow. We got to the cafe just after 4 p.m. amen had to wait 45 minutes for a table. Server worked hard, food was tasty but warm.
food is good..with all interior really hard rock... location is superb in broadway, time square... the staff is very friendly and always help you with smile...
Went here for lunch while visiting time square. We've been to a couple Hard Rock restaurants and as expected, this was good. If you've never been to one I recommend it for the experience.
Hard Rock Cafe is in times square and there is lot of customers but service is fast and burgers tasty.
I've eaten at HRC in various cities around the world, and the NYC one is well, just like all the rest! Decent food with huge amounts! Same decor, just a bigger place!
What you'd expect from any Hard Rock Cafe. Service and food was good. Had to sit at the bar and eat even though there were 15-20 empty tables.

Nothing great about this place. Nothing wrong with it either. Just a plain and simple Hard Rock. I went mid-week and didn't have to queue which was a bonus. The food was good, filling as usual. Service was also fine. Just nothing wowed me.
First time in New York and went here. Service was appalling and food even worse.... Our burger came up still frozen in the middle. Given a $25 gift card to say sorry but this can only be used on food
Most Hard Rock Cafe food is the same at all locations. The menus might be a bit different, but the food is good and one thing they always do is fill up your plate, so you never leave hungry.
Try one, you won't be disappointed, and the fries are delicious. One of the best burger and chip meals I've ever eaten, in a brilliant setting full of musical history.
Hard Rock Café does offer a great atmosphere. If you want to just hang out with friend and not worried about the cuisine, then this is the place for you.
This is one of the better Hard Rock's I've visited. With New York's rich music history, it's great to see these vintage items. The Beatles suites are here among hundreds of other props.
Service was ok food a bit over priced compared to other hard rock cafes but worth a visit to the shop if you collect hard rock items.

It is just like every other Hard Rock Cafe. If you've seen one, you've seen this one. Food and service were not bad but it was nothing extravagant. I would recommend going to a restaurant you can only find in NY and not a chain.
Had drinks and food sitting at the bar which we prefer. Great service very friendly. Thank you Josh. Great atmosphere x
Went here with friends for a tourist experience- it was ok-service good, burgers were fine & cooked to order. Kitschy but fun.
I like the Hard Rock Cafes, this one is just like the others with all the memorabilia. It can seat a lot of people and table wait wasn't bad.

column3: Best Hard Rock you will visit
column4: Atmosphere was second to none, food was average but to be honest you go to the hard rock cafe for the experience, not the food although the bacons burger was pure class! visited with my school in febuary 2013
Really good burgers and they are huge! Also good music and atmosphere. Nice place for dinner or just a drink at the bar. Will go here again!
We went here after seeing Chicago. The service and food was fantastic and and the look of the restraunt was amazing.
well, we all know that hard rock cafe is cool. the location of the new york one is great and it is quite big. not super special but a decent cool hrc!
Terry the waiter was the best. Food was good and the drinks were cold. We had a good time. What more can you ask for? We left happy
We visited Hard rock on our last day and wish we had done so sooner. Service was excellent, food good and cocktails amazing. We will be back on our next visit to New York

Food lovely! But the waiter made the service Top notch! He was so funny and made our experience so great! He used to come from the same country as us and he knew what we were saying even with our strong accents!
It is your typical Hard Rock but the environment is electric. Must be the location. Service was a bit slow even at 10:30 PM. The food was great and the menu had a lot of variety.
Poor service, mediocre food, place could do with a good tidy up and some sort of system would help. But it's Hard Rock so will always attract, until you get in and have to wiat for service
Nearly empty, good service but food nothing special. Wouldn't go again. But out waiter was great, everything looked tired rather than vintage.

column3: Fantastic food with a wonderful atmosphere
column4: Thoroughly enjoyed our meal here! Burgers were all tasty. Service was great. We would all definitely return.

column3: Ok - Fair price for Times Square
column4: Service good, food ok but nothing special but then can you go wrong with a burger? On the plus side thought it was good value for money considering it was in Times Square.

Visited twice with my husband on a recent trip to New York to celebrate our anniversary. Food was plentiful and tasty. Cocktails and wine delicious. We ate at the bar as we like a relaxed dining experience. Service was great. Would definitely return.

column3: One of the best HRC we have been to!
column4: Situated in the famous Paramount Building, HRC NYC has the original doors from Abbey Road and some lovely John Lennon pieces. Service was quick and the food was some of the best we have tasted in a HRC.
Below the shop and bar was dark,busy and service was slow. Cocktails were nice and reasonably priced.
We visited here just because you have to. It was simply amazing with the rock memorabilia, with Billy Joel's Motorcycle the wall of guitars and such friendly staff. A must to visit.
It's like a rock museum, Nice food. It is a little expensive, though, however worth it. Very nice location, over TIme Square Garden.
Nice breakfastbuffe, bacon, eggs, pancakes and The other usual stuff for about 17.99. Nothing Spectacular but totally ok!
Visited hear at the end of Jan with my partner. No wait lots of free tables. Excellent food...hugeeee portion sizes and even bigger deserts. I'm sure if we go back to NYC we will visit again.
hard rock cafe located in times square so gets very busy but reasonably priced drinks and good food great atmosphere and cramed with music memorabelia
I had the brisket nachos! I took the picture with the guitar. It was a good cheat meal! I check out all the Hard Rock's! I'd visit again!
Very nice atmosphere, very good and nice staff, delicious hamburgers, good music, normally price, smoking sun. Everything was fantastic...
Hard Rock is never disappointing! The best burgers and the drinks are always perfect! The staff are very friendly and always smiling, and the atmosphere is super cool :)
I ordered nachos to start, I had to cancel the main!! The size of the plate was huge!! Nice interior and the waiting staff are lush!! Right in the middle of Times Square, so it's worth a visit!
Great food and great cocktails!!portions huge! Was brilliant to get a seat in amongst the hustle and bustle of Times Square i reserved a table online before we came on holiday as its very busy.
We love all of the Hard Rock Cafe's. The food was good and worth the wait for NYC. Price is higher in Manhattan than our home area of Phoenix and the wait was worth the half hour time to get seated.

column3: If you have never been give it a try
column4: This is the third Hard Rock I have dined in and it is the Best of 3. Love the food, location and service... will go back next time I am in the city
There's is nothing special about the overpriced food. Unfortunately, the service was dreadful. You are really paying for atmosphere.
Where ever you go, Hard Rock is a must on the agenda! The one in NYC is no different. Food, service & atmosphere are always great!!!

The queue was huge and as we only wanted a drink were able to go in although could not find a seat for love or money. Found the staff arrogant and rude and not too bothered about customer service. Disappointed

loved the wings - seasoned and not "just hot". the bruschetta was good too, large pieces of toast with a generous helping of fresh tomatoes, etc. Service was good - not too pushy, available when needed.

The food was good and the place was typical hard rock. The service from our hostess was not so good though, it seemed to us that she was a bit tired of her job, which made the hole experience average.
Restaurant typical of this chain. We said we needed to eat quickly as going to a show and we did! The food and service was ok
Went for a late night dinner. Great service and great food. Had the onion rings as the appetizer, then the BBQ ribs which were HUGE and my husband has the hamburger which he loved.
This was a lovely experience, very good food, service and good fun. It is very interesting with all the memorabilia and great that they took a photo of us that we could buy.

Stopped in for appetizer and drinks. Typical HR menu. Good selections. Great service from Nathaniel. He went the extra mile to help determine our rewards number do we could get credit for our visit! He pushed this rating to "very good".

column3: One of the best collection of HRs
column4: Very good, big, nice and friendly staff,spacious and good food! Recommended for all ages! There was nothing bad on my visit
We got seated very quickly. We had the app assortment, burger & Cobb salad. Service was great. Food was what we expected.

There was a 20 minute wait for a table but you can shop upstairs and walk around and see the memorabilia. The server was very helpful and attentive, even though the restaurant was very busy. The food was great!
It was ok and nice to say I had been there but nothing special could get better food else where. Service was ok but not great

The service and food were extremely poor. They ran out of ice while we were there. Service was slow. Shake was a WASTE of money. Very little shake or alcohol. Hamburger was average tasting. Do not waste your time here.
The hamburgers were wonderful. A wide selection. All around $ 16.00 which included fries. The decorations from so many musicians are fascinating and keep the kids busy and entertained.
Amazing food, had a great atmosphere and brilliant location, you never get tired of hard rock cafés!!

Usually a fan of Hard Rock Cafe. This was disappointing though. Somewhat better than Oslo, but a lot worse than Orlando and others... Ok Service, ok Food, price as expected, still not hooray, will give it another chance though.
Excellent food and a very nice place. Was overwhelmed by the whole experience. All staff made us feel very welcomed.

Had a great meal at Hard Rock NY, huge servings and very tasty although prices a bit steep. Good service with friendly staff and didn't have to wait for a table. Well worth a visit but not as good as Hard Rock in Vegas.
Usually this place is guaranteed good burgers for the family, but this visit was a little average. Mostly overdone and poor service due to number of guests eating.
Overpriced and distinctly average food only made up for by the setting and the great music mementos inside and out. Much better places than this around.
Food is fantastic, we had a Combo of appetizers along with our cocktails.it was fantastic and amazing and yummy...

Following reviews posted previously we left with plenty time before our show however there was no wait at all! We were seated immediately, all the staff were polite & friendly. The food was great as at every Hard Rock Cafe we have visited!
Brilliant service - there was a queue in which we had to wait to be seated but it was worth the wait! Not overly expensive either - but its not about price if your in new York.. its the experience :)
well Hard Rock café... had to go there... its pretty much the standart. nice people, average food, average beer, not so average prices ;)
Great food, service and atmosphere. Well worth a visit. Had a short wait on a Wednesday evening but it was well worth it. So glad we went.

column3: Long wait for so, so food
column4: Have been here several times, while checking out Broadway shows. Burgers and chicken sandwiches are good, but if you stray from the basics; watch out! Expect to wait, so don't go if you are in a rush or have a curtain to make.

column3: So Much Fun for Beatle and Dylan Fans
column4: Pure fun. Wonderful displays- original Beatle suits, guitar wall. Waiter great. Short wait for table. Food excellent and reasonable by New York standards. We will return.
Just tired of this place.. It's in Dublin, vegas & New York. Time for something totally new.. Food & service can't complain but just boring now..
Both the burger, the salad, the drinks and the waiter were doing a very good job. It is not the cheapest place to eat, but you do get a lot in return, including atmosphere.
Our first restaurant in NYC, it was a very neat place to go. In the heart of Time Square, very busy place! The food was great and the staff was very friendly!
Now I've have been to 4 hard rock cafe and let me say that so far I have two hard rock cafe that are my favorite and nyc is one great staff excellent food will come back again

column3: Very nice night out but a little overrated
column4: Everyone seemed to make a big fuss about the Hard Rock Cafe but I personally thought it was very average. Nice, but average. Perhaps not my scene as thoroughly enjoyed by everyone else.
One of the better Hard Rocks for an atmosphere, set under times square. Great food as usual, great service as usual and an all round really good dining experience just like every other hard rock!
My first trip to N.Y. first time eating at hard rock.steak I ordered was cooked perfect plus they had odouls
Standard Hard Rock experience. Decent food and decor. Crowded but that is to be expected given it's in Times Square and it's summer in NYC. Great if your just looking for a good chain restaurant.
The food is what you would expect if you have been to a Hard Rock Cafe before. The service is good and you don't wait long for your meal to be delivered.

Spent the day in NYC with husband and 2 kids, stopped at hard rock for a break between museums. The kids had so much fun with the eclectic ambiance and enjoyed the hustle and bustle of the restaurant. Food was good, so were the cocktails.
Had a veggie burger, very good....we waited about 40 minutes for a table, not bad on a Saturday night in New York!!! The service was excellent & so was the food!! Lots of cool stuff to look at too!!!
We traveled with a large high school group of 30. We had to wait a little for our reserved seating, but the service, proximity of seating, and food was still terrific.
Friendly service, good food. Energetic atmosphere. Prices were consistent with the area. Enjoyed the decor. Restrooms were clean as was the restaurant.

Food was typical Hard Rock - usual American favorites. The Hard Rock 'store' is street level and you have to walk downstairs for restaurant seating. Very dark and dim. Good bar service. The food quality/seasoning was very good so gave high marks.
Always must visit the Hard Rock Cafe they all the same and love em all great atmosphere same food great music love all serve all

column3: Just what you'd expect from any HRC
column4: Just like in any other HRC, the burgers were delicious, the cocktails rocked and the prices were reasonable given the location. I found it less noisy that the HRC of LA that we know well. The service was ok, as usual.

Our family went here after a Broadway show. It was nearly midnight but the place was very busy and loud. Our teenagers had steak dinners and ate everything. My daughter and I just enjoyed appetizers. It was all good and the service great.
We've eaten in Hard Rock Cafes in London & Florida. The food is pretty much standard (great quality). The New York restaurant is particularly noisy.
I have never had a bad meal at a Hard Rock Cafe. We had not been to the one in NYC in years (since the old location, yes I'm old). We were not disappointed, everything was as good as any other HRC.

column3: breakfast - eat as much as you like!
column4: good selection of food including fresh pineapple, melon & bananas. cereals, bagels, toast, sausages, bacon, eggs, juices, tea and coffee. attentive and fun servers. cost $17 per person
I always try to hit a Hard Rock Café if theirs one in the place I go to. good food. cool people, young and old. photos and rock paraphernalia were worth seeing
Our first meal experience was so great that we returned the following two days. The burgers are excellent and you have to try the onion rings.
We ate at three HRC on this vacation and the Times Square location was amazing. Huge and roomy. Never been a fan of the food, but the wife and kids love it, it was good
Right in the middle of times square had a little museum with it with some very cool stuff and the rest aunt was a good experience good food good service

Don't usually eat at chain restaurants in NYC but we were starving and we were in Times Square. The food was reasonably priced for the city and tasted great. It is a large restaurant and was not that crowded. I would return

What a fun atmosphere in Times Square! The food was good, but this place is more about the atmosphere. The waiters are fun and the restaurant is really cool! It is a must see if you are a music fan. Teenagers will LOVE it!!!
went here in feb 2014 great place to eat and great atmoshere would go again no worries the food was really tasty and portions were large great value for money

The ac was cold and the drinks and food very good! This is one of the coolest HRC's that we have been to! Loved the entrance and the restrooms! The salads, burgers and fries were all superb! Would definitely visit again whn in NYC!
I love Hard Rock cafes! This is one is underground, Dark, nice music and great food. Staff is courteous. Loved it
My sister and I went for a late dinner - the staff were so pleasant and friendly and the food was delicious!
This is a normal HR Café but they sell a breakfast buffet in the morning. We went to try it one morning and it was impossible as there was so many people trying to get in!
a dinner for 3 may cost you 100 us or more if you have dessert.is a very cozy place.can visit with family or with couple.you can buy lots of merchandising ,but before check on the page for offers,
Great decor all around some interesting memorabilia, good service with good food and drink although not the cheapest.
I'm assuming this is the one on Times Square. Recommend the breakfast buffet. All you can eat and drink for $17 including taxes and tips is good value. Good range of food.

column3: Great place to eat great atmosphere
column4: I have visited Many hard rock cafés and have to say this was one of the best iv been to atmosphere was great, food great and the cocktails alcoholic and non alcoholic were amazing can't wait to go back. Staff are really friendly and funny.
I had a barbecue pulled pork burger and it was the nicest I've ever had! Service was delightful and atmosphere was great. Can't wait to return!!

column3: Great Area, good food, good service
column4: The best review was already given when the person said it is your typical Hard Rock. Nothing More, Nothing Less. We went more for burgers than anything else. They were good...a little higher than most other Hard Rocks, but it is in Times Square...
Big cafe, downstairs. Staff very nice and helpful. Son and I had lunch there. Would recommend . Brought home a few items from gift shop.
Food is great, staff are friendly and helpful and the decor is amazing. Definitely worth a visit even just to see all the memorabilia around the room.
Have visited several Hard Rocks in the past this is the best we have visited. Food & service excellent (although a bit pricey due to name).

column3: Must visit for ambiance if not food :)
column4: Its right at the time sq. Lot of space. Good music, good food. Great interior, has a big guitar at the entrance. in shore, loved it.

column3: Great Burger in an iconic venue
column4: First time in New York City, stopping around the block near Times Square. My seventeen year old daughter spotted the restaurant and we visited on Tuesday. Didn't have to wait long. Great service and food. Atmosphere was buzzing and would visit again . Highly recommended.
Fab burgers and great service. Also a great place for momentoes of times gone by in the music industry. We all enjoyed the food!
Visit The Hard Rock Cafe at Time Square in NY was an excellent visit. The staff was very helpfull and give me a seat at the bar. I order a Fish Filet Sandwich and it was very tasty.
Typical Hard Rock food, burgers, steaks etc, great memorabilia on the pictures and on the walls. A great place to go when in New York. A cool restaurant near to Times Square.

column3: A great place for a break
column4: Food good. Service reasonable. Environment excellent. Just don't let then sit you near the entrance door. Take a good look around to see the exhibits

Considerable wait for a table, but that is expected. Also had to wait quite a long time for our food, but the waitress was attentive and made sure we had drinks full while we waited. Food was pretty good- large portions served!
I really enjoy Hard Rock in whatever city they are. On Times Square, the location is hopping. The service was great! The drinks were tasty. The food was consistent with other Hard Rock Cafe's.
Nothing relevant to highlight this restaurant keep the standard of franchises good and tasty food, luckily not wait list during our visit was a good experience.

We visited from Australia and had to call into the Hard Rock Cafe in New York City. The atmosphere was excellent and the meals were huge, the food quality and service was good. Well worth a visit when in NYC.
Had a great buffet - good selection - great surroundings - interesting memorabilia to check out . The gift store if fun to explore and the staff is very service oriented.
A little noisy, but otherwise a good experience. Food was good, prices fair, excellent service. All that you'd expect at the Hard Rock
Not so different with the same hard rock places you could find anywhwere... Located in the heart of Times square makes the difference
Everybody should go to the Hard Rock Café whilst in New York. The food was really good and they cater for hundreds of people both old and young which is great to see. Well done to them.
I don't think you can go wrong with Hard Rock ever, the keep the same standard of food, drinks and service everywhere i the world!
Who likes rock'n'roll will really enjoy that place. Good music and good food. I just had the nchos, but it was delicious.
A great place to go in and look around. Merchandise for sale. Great photo opportunities. Cafe downstairs.
This is a classic Hard Rock cafe , plenty of star power on the walls , nicely laid out, good music on the screens , service as expected , food quality as good as it gets for a Hard Rock.
Just what you'd expect of Hard a Rock. Brilliant staff, great atmosphere and great food. Has all you'd expect in New a york City
When we are in NYC we come here after every Broadway performance we see at night. The atmosphere is fun and the restaurant has a cool look to it. We love this place!

Always busy so may need to queue to get in. Therefore make sure you get there early and then have a few drinks at the bar before you eat. If you love rock music with your burgers you will love this place.

column3: It's Hard to top the Hard Rock
column4: Really great food as usual. Very big restaurant and as you would expect it was very busy. However the staff were excellent and made us feel welcome
Hard rock fan so it was disappointing to be let down in what should be a flagship restaurant. On duty manager did respond well to our complaint so not all bad
Sorry to say, but the food was cold, service was slow, staff didn't seem interested, and it was over priced! Needless to say we won't be going back in a hurry.

column3: Great time even in lunch rush
column4: Enjoyable meal in a can't miss venue. Our server, Teddy, was very friendly and attentive. Greet staff perhaps not as friendly. Great menu.
This one is no different than the others which is not a bad thing. The food was great and our service was very good. We did have to wait a bit but you usually do at all Hard Rock Cafe's.

column3: Just like any other Hard Rock Cafe
column4: Food was good, staff were very helpful. The cocktails were lush! There is better restaurants to visit in the area but it was good!
All the Hard Rock's I've been to are pretty much the same. We ordered the Jumbo Appetizer and it was good. Burgers are overpriced, but you are paying for the vibrant atmosphere.

Recently ate here three times during New York visit. Food is amazing but the que is really bad so book in advance. Watch out for the pushy blond German waitress who is very rude when she doesn't get the tip she wants!

column3: Rock n' Roll and nice food
column4: We got a table in front of Ringo Star Drums, the environmental is amazing, service very professional and the food is delicious.

Went on a Saturday night and though the restaurant was packed, didn't wait excessively for a table. Had the greatest server named Harrys, great energy and very attentive. Would highly recommend, lots of fun.
Set in the heart of times square, you really get that "buzz" from all the hustling and bustling going on inside. Food was great, staff were very friendly, a bit busy but great fun!
Had dinner at Hard Rock Cafe. The spinach Burger was delicious, Ambiance nice-Good service-Quick and very friendly.

We went expecting to have to wait but on both occasions we got a table very quickly.Staff were courteous and polite on greeting us and were shown to our table,provided with iced water and assigned a waitress.The service was quick and the food lovely,I had...More

This is like all other Hard Rocks. You go for the scenery. The staff downstairs (where the restaurant is) are not friendly. It is almost like they are ticked you are there. In the past we have used our VIP card and have been seated in decent time, but we were told they have now done away with the cards. That was a lot of money I paid for the card which is now useless. The wait staff has always been friendly. They are helpful but they are really busy at all hours of the day. The food is medium. But again… remember you are really going for the scenery. Because we are aware of that… we have never had an unpleasant experience. It is just a fun place to go to say you have been there. It is a great place to people watch but don't expect to carry on a conversation. It is very loud too. Again though… remember where you are at. But for a fun place… try it!

Arrived in New York late afternoon and we were quite hungry saw The Hard Rock -awful The fries were child portions , hard and covered in black spots . None of the cocktails were priced and when we asked the Waitress she didn't know the prices! It was expensive and the only good thing we were served quickly which meant we could escape even quicker ! Claire & Joe London UK
Set in the heart of times square, you really get that "buzz" from all the hustling and bustling going on inside. Food was great, staff were very friendly, a bit busy but great fun!

I am a massive fan of the Hard Rock Cafe, and have visited many over the years... However I was extremely disappointed with this one.  I can't believe I've had to give a poor review to this restaurant, but right from the time I entered the place, the staff were sooo rude... The girl who showed us to the seat had a right attitude, and basically threw the menus down on the table then disappeared off without saying a word to us... All other Hard Rocks I've been to the staff have been extremely friendly.. It's kind of the way the staff should be because it's such friendly atmosphere normally!  When the food came, if was cold and we hadn't even finished our jumbo combo when my very expensive and very cold steak turned up on my table!!!  I would say there are better places to eat in NYC for anyone who is thinking if going.

We walked in and were told there was an approximate ten minute wait. We had our photo taken professionally and waited for about 4 minutes before being led to a table. The tables were at a comfortable distance apart and not squashed together, and the atmosphere is very rock and roll. I ordered chicken fajitas, the marinated chicken came on a bed of stir fried onions and peppers and the lettuce, cheese and wraps were all separate and for you to put together which was perfect for me being a fussy eater. For my chicken fajitas, a refillable soda drink and my share of the price for the professional photo we had taken it cost me $26.

Just had to go here as we went to the Hard Rock Cafe in Orlando last year and wanted to compare. Was seated just after a short wait. Slightly disappointed with my choice of dinner. The dish was described as twisted pasta that the waiter described as the twisted part being the very spicy sauce. Flavour great, looked superb but lacking in 'twist'. I was hoping for a good kick of chilli but it seems like the chef had just added one extra turn of the pepper mill. Would we go back again? Very much so, the atmosphere was great, the place was absolutely buzzing Other reviews have said the place was noisy, we call that being in New York!

I'm a frequent Hard Rock Cafe visitor & have been to a few around the world & go to the London Cafe a couple of times a year...  The Hard Rock Cafe New York just on Times Square is the best one I've visited. It was massive inside the restaurant with a lovely huge square bar you can sit around while you wait for your table. We only had a 10 minute wait, barely enough time to finish our cocktails! (I'm used to 30 minute waits in London at any given time). The decoration was gorgeous lovely colour changing lights hanging over the bar. Our server was lovely & accommodating. The portions were quite large (expected at any Hard Rock) and prices were reasonable (though it's not "cheap"). We had the potato skins to start which were good, a burger & fajitas for mains, my fajitas were really good & there was so much I barely looked like I'd eaten anything when I'd finished! We were too full for deserts. The barman did a little flair performance to a Black Eyed Peas song which attracted a crowd & cheers & applause, but we couldn't see much from our table as the restaurant is nicely spread out. It was a great atmosphere, lovely, welcoming & friendly staff & great food. Highly recommend.

Hard Rock Cafe. the icon of the nineties when we provincials all wanted to go there and the T shirts where proud possessions.
